text: A cornish who, because of these things of fate, was larger than her companions, despising and mocking her fellow citizens, went to live among the crows asking them to agree to share her life. But the crows, who were unfamiliar with her figure and voice, unwittingly beat her and threw her out of their group. And the hornet, driven out by the crows, returned to the other hornets. But these women, wounded by the outrage that had befallen them, refused to receive her again. Thus, this cornea was excluded from the society of each and every other. When you think about changing friendships, do not despise those you had before.
title: La corneja con los cuervos
author: nan Esopo
